page.title: 17BRICKWORKS _ BRISCO
page.content: There has been a brickworks here at Brisco since 1934.It was built near a sand pit but this is now exhausted and the sand is obtained from Faugh.The bricks are made from a mixture of sand and crushed stone together with water and hydrated lime.The mix is computer controlled then subjected to pressure of 3 tons per square inch and cured in high pressure steam in an autoclave. Common and facing bricks are made,the latter in either smooth or rough finish in a choice of ten colours. Specials in different shapes can also be ordered.Up to 400,000 bricks a week are made here but Mr.Tweddle,the manager for 20 years,said that their business is dependent on the ups and downs of the building trade.20 men work here.Laings own the works.The biggest changes have been in the introduction of automated machinery.
